Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Mobile Interventions for Peripheral Arterial Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients with diagnosed PAD, aged 18 or older. This randomised controlled trial was conducted at the vascular outpatient clinic of the West-German Heart and Vascular Center, University Clinic Essen, Germany.

Intervention.evidence: Key app components identified were "information," "feedback," "choosing goals," and "interaction with physicians and therapists."

Objective.evidence: This study aims to identify the needs and requirements of PAD patients for mobile interventions to support supervised exercise therapy (SET).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the identification of patient needs for mobile interventions, measured over a 3-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 304 patients were randomised, with 157 allocated to the intervention group and 147 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on all randomised participants using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A significant need for better support was identified, with 59.2% expressing a desire for more disease-related support.
